item.title: Interpretation of Machine Learning Models
item.description: Machine learning(ML) is an approach to learn some pattern of data, and leverage it to infer unseen data. The same statement is valid for statistics.
item.content:encoded: Machine learning(ML) is an approach to learn some pattern of data, and leverage it to infer unseen data. The same statement is valid for statistics. This is because the essence of ML theory comes from statistics. In this post, I will explain how to interpret the output of ML models from a statistical perspective.
